text:
Kings Highway, north side, at East 38th Street, showing the Jeremiah Bergen House, erected about 1850, and occupied by his son Theodore in 1922. Now (1936), it is no longer standing. The Bergen farm consisted of about 30 acres. The elder Bergen had three sons, Jerome L., a farmer and engineer, Theodore, a farmer and Edgar, a lawyer. He also had two daughters, Sarah unmarried and Anna who married Benj. G. Hitchings, father of the present J. G. Hitchings.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

The same, from another angle.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 38th Street (East)

title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 38th Street (East)

text:
(1) Kings Highway, north side, at East 38th Street, showing the Jeremiah Bergen home, erected in 1850 and occupied by him from 1860 to 1873; and by Theo. Bergen from 1879 to 1923. It was razed December 1925.

1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, another view.

1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST
